IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PRESERVING AND PROTECTING THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT ON AND AROUND SANIBEL-CAPTIVA
IRS990.MissionDesc: SCCF IS DEDICATED TO THE CONSERVATION OF COASTAL HABITATS AND AQUATIC RESOURCES ON SANIBEL AND CAPTIVA AND IN THE SURROUNDING WATERSHED.
IRS990.Desc: MARINE LABORATORY- INVESTIGATE THE STATUS AND TRENDS AND TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH OF THE HABITAT AND FAUNA WITHIN THE MARINE NURSERY AREAS IN AND AROUND THE BARRIER ISLANDS OF SANIBEL-CAPTIVA. SUPPORTED BY PUBLIC CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HABITAT MANAGEMENT- ENSURE THE PROTECTION OF LAND FOR WILDLIFE HABITAT. WORK TO RESTORE, MANAGE AND MAINTAIN LAND TO SUPPORT NATIVE SPECIES OF PLANTS AND ANIMALS. SUPPORTED BY PUBLIC CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: NATIVE LANDSCAPES AND GARDEN CENTER- RESEARCH/EDUCATIONAL FACILITY FOR THE STUDY, PROPAGATION, AND CARE OF NATIVE PLANTS, AND TO MAKE THEM AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC USE IN THE LOCAL AREA.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: RESEARCH, ENVIRONMENTAL AND WATER QUALITY EDUCATION- RESEARCH, EDUCATIONAL FACILITY, CONSERVATION CENTER EXHIBIT AREA AND PROGRAMS THAT PROMOTE THE PROTECTION OF THE NATURAL RESOURCES OF SANIBEL AND CAPTIVA ISLAND. SUPPORTED BY ADMISSION FEES, PUBLIC CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART II-B, 1.D: THIS ACTIVITY INCLUDED PREPARATION, PRINTING, AND POSTAGE FOR MAILING AND ALERTS ASSOCIATED WITH LEGISLATION INVOLVING LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION. PART II-B, 1.G: THIS ACTIVITY INVOLVED DIRECT CONTACT WITH LEGISLATORS REGARDING LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION ISSUES. PART II-B, 1.H: THIS ACTIVITY INVOLVED SPEECHES GIVEN TO THE PUBLIC REGARDING LAND & WATER CONSERVATION LEGISLATION.

THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS DESIGNATED PORTIONS OF THE FOUNDATION'S UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS. CERTAIN PARCELS OF LAND HAVE BEEN DESIGNATED TO BE SET ASIDE IN THEIR NATURAL STATE BY THE FOUNDATION. ADDITIONALLY, CASH, CASH EQUIVALENTS AND MUTUAL FUNDS HAVE BEEN DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD TO BE SEPARATELY INVESTED AND EARNINGS USED FOR LAND PRESERVATION, NATURAL HABITAT RESTORATION AND MANAGEMENT, RESEARCH AND EDUCATION AND PROTECTION OF WILDLIFE. TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS (TERM) CONSIST OF FUNDS RESTRICTED FOR DEFERRED MEMBERSHIP DUES, OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE MARINE LABORATORY, AND RECEIVABLES FROM THE FOUNDATIONS' ANNUAL FUND DRIVE. PERMENANTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS ARE COMPRISED OF ENDOWMENTS WHOSE EARNINGS ARE RESTRICTED FOR PURPOSES OF ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, PRESERVATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES, HABITAT MANAGEMENT, SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION, AND LAND HOLDINGS PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED FOR PRESERVATION.

THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IT QUALIFIES FOR THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION DEDUCTION UNDER SECTION 170(1)(A) AND HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A)(2). THE FOUNDATION HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED IT HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2018. THE FOUNDATION'S 2017, 2016 AND 2015 TAX YEARS ARE OPEN FOR EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.
COST OF SALES INCLUDED IN EXPENSES ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 91,361.

FundraisingEventInformationGrp.Event1Nm: WINE IN THE WILD ANNIVERSARY EVENT

OtherNonCashContriTableGrp.Desc: PRIZES FOR FUNDRAISER RAFFLES AND AUCTIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORPORATION MAY HAVE ONE OR MORE CLASSES OF MEMBERS. THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF MEMBERSHIP, THE CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP, AND MEMBERSHIP DUES, IF, ANY, SHALL BE AS DETERMINED FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ALL MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION IN GOOD STANDING, AS SHOWN ON THE FOUNDATION'S MEMBERSHIP ROLLS TEN BUSINESS DAYS PRIOR TO THE ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEMBERSHIP MEETING SHALL BE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION. EACH MEMBER SHALL HAVE ONE VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PERSON MAY BE NOMINATED AS A CANDIDATE FOR ELECTION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES BY A WRITTEN PETITION SIGNED BY NOT LESS THAN TWENTY PERCENT OF THE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION WHO ARE IN GOOD STANDING AT THE TIME SAID PETITION IS SUBMITTED TO THE NOMINATING COMMITTEE. IF NOMINATION IS DEEMED SUFFICIENT BY THE NOMINATING COMMITTEE, THE NAME OF EACH PERSON SO NOMINATED SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AS A CANDIDATE FOR ELECTION BY THE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION AT THE ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, FINANCE COMMITTEE, BOARD TREASURER, BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND BUSINESS MANAGER PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DISCUSSION OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY DURING REGULARLY SCHEDULED STAFF MEETINGS AND BOARD OF DIRECTOR MEETINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS OF DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE FOUNDATION, INCLUDING THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, DOES INCLUDE REVIEW BY INDEPENDENT PERSONS, COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUS DELIBERATION. THE FOUNDATION HAS A FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIRED BY THE TREASURER WITH MEMBERS FROM THE COMMUNITY, INDEPENDENT OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THIS COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE ENTIRE FOUNDATION BUDGET, INCLUDING COMPENSATION, AND MAKES ITS RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, BOARD POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AND AT WWW.SCCF.ORG
COGS RECOGNIZED AS PROGRAM EXPENSE ON 990 BUT NOT INCLUDED AS REVENUE 91,361.

THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, FINANCE COMMITTEE, BOARD TREASURER, BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND BUSINESS MANAGER PRIOR TO ISSUANCE. NO CHANGES HAVE OCCURRED DURING THE YEAR.
